intro: Lessingia ramulosa, commonly known as the ramose lessingia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes mustard plants, and is characterized by its small, white or pink flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often in arid or semi-arid environments. It has a low, sprawling growth habit with hairy stems and narrow, linear leaves. The flowers bloom in clusters, and the plant is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and desert scrub.
